headline: Farmer's Casserole
description: A farmer's casserole is a tasty, make-ahead breakfast dish with ham, eggs, hash browns, and spicy pepper Jack cheese that the whole family will love!

video.description: Fluffy eggs layered with ham and potatoes for the perfect breakfast or brunch.
video.name: Farmer's Casserole

name: Farmer's Casserole

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
Arrange hash brown potatoes evenly in the bottom of the prepared dish. Sprinkle with pepper Jack cheese, then ham, and finally green onions.
Whisk evaporated milk, eggs, pepper, and salt together in a medium bowl; pour over layers in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: This is delicious, although not as thick as in the picture. I think next time I'll use a 8x8 glass dish. I used the Ore Ida frozen potatoes o'brien and chopped cooked bacon instead of ham, shredded cheddar and shredded italian cheese blend in 9x11 metal baking pan. Baked 40 minutes.
I added diced ham and velveeta cheese, and frozen O’brien potatoes. It was DELICIOUS,
Easy to make and delicious. This was a big hit with my family.
I followed the recipe to the letter, and just loved the results.

I found this recipe years ago in a magazine. The only difference between this one and the one I've used is the cheese. My recipe calls for Monterey Jack cheese. I will be trying Pepper Jack next time. In some parts of the country hash browns are shredded and in other parts they are diced. I use the diced version. I originally looked up the recipe because mine says to refrigerate several hours or overnight. I couldn't see any reason except to prepare in advance. This recipe showed that I don't have to do that. Thank you.
This was delicious and my family loved it. I used breakfast sausage instead of ham for more flavor and also added onion powder to the egg mixture. Will definitely make it again!
I made the recipe and followed the instructions. The exception of 1/3 cup of onions vs 1/4 cup. I was surprised by the sweetness of the did casserole . That’s when I discovered I errorred
awesome
I added 3 more eggs with a little half and half and more cheese on top. This made the recipe a little more dense. Made it for New Yesterday’s day for 6 people. Was a wonderful hit.
I thought this sounded good. I made it and it tastes more amazing then I thought it would. I’ll be doubling the recipe next time

I gave it 4 stars because I changed stuff. I call this Denver omlet casserole. for 2 of us, I precooked potatoes, 1qt dish. ham, bell pepper and onion. cheddar cheese. 4oz evaporated milk, 3 eggs. chilled overnight, cooked for about 55 min. came out perfect!!! tomorrow, I'm cooking a "meat lovers" casserole. just add sausage and bacon. serve with a side of biscuits and gravy!!

This is a great brunch casserole. Goes together quick and tastes great! Everyone in the family loved it! I did use half mild cheddar and half pepper jack for the cheeses so the kids would like it better. We will definitely make it again!
this was easy to make and turned out very good. I added some mushrooms to this recipie.

I used sweet sausage (had some on hand) instead of ham. Turned out okay but surprisingly, it was actually better two/three days later. Had more flavor. So will adjust accordingly--using more flavor spices. Easy to make. Thanks.

This recipe was very easy to follow. I’m so glad I listened to the other reviewers and used O’Brien potatoes instead. Even with the pepper jack cheese, I felt the flavor was somewhat bland. It also took 90 min to fully cook/set. It’s a definite keeper, but I will lightly salt the potatoes beforehand next time.

I made this twice so far, and it's delicious. The 2nd time I added 1 additional egg, added extra pepper jack cheese on the very top, and covered with foil in the oven for the first 30 minutes, and it was much more better

I have made this or a variation of this for many years. It is most versital recipe that can be made all year long. I usually use frozen hashbrowns, a whole onion ( diced ), thick sliced applewood or hickory cured bacon ( diced and cooked ahead of time ), shreaded spinach, and colby jack cheese. It's always a wonderful treat!

I had to add quite of bit of cooking time. When I took it out at the given time, it was runny on the bottom. After addition time in the oven, my family couldn't leave it alone. My son put Salsa on it. Breakfast is just not breakfast without Salsa around here.

I used O'Brian frozen hash browns and 4 Mexican cheese shredded cheese. Replaced ham with crumbled sausage. Doubled the recipe (except Evaporated milk) Four adults polished off the 9x13 casserole. :) It was most favorably received!

Excellent! Doubled recipe to feed a crowd. Used hash browns with onions and peppers and also substituted Monterey Jack cheese instead of pepper jack due to young kids eating it. I will definitely make this again!
One of my favorite “go to” recipes when feeding a large crowd for breakfast
Outstanding! My family loved it! I used sausage and a bit more cheese than it called for!

I’m giving this a 3 star as is. I wish I would’ve listened to some of the reviewers and used the Potatoes O’Brien. To me this casserole was missing something-maybe the potatoes needed to be seasoned with something. Also, the bake time on this casserole is way off! I ended up having to cook it for 1 1/2 hours and then my cheese topping was completely browned and no good. Next time I’ll cook the casserole without the cheese and add it to the last 10 minutes of bake time.

I’m giving this a 3 star as is. I wish I would’ve listened to some of the reviewers and used the Potatoes O’Brien. To me this casserole was missing something-maybe the potatoes needed to be seasoned with something. Also, the bake time on this casserole is way off! I ended up having to cook it for 1 1/2 hours and then my cheese topping was completely browned and no good. Next time I’ll cook the casserole without the cheese and add it to the last 10 minutes of bake time.
I thought the hashbrowns should probably be on top and broiled at the last to be crispy.
Easy recipe, I took the advice of others and used Potatoes O’Brien. I added Hot Italian sausage to the chopped ham and used cheddar cheese along with the Pepper jack. Everyone enjoyed the dish.
I made no change and it was great
I will make again. Husband and son enjoyed it. Used the hash browns with onions and peppers in them. Also, worked with using evaporated skim milk.
Potatoes O'Brtien and colby/jack cheese worked gerat!
I made this recipe the night before. It was GREAT! My kids loved it... even had seconds! I found it was very quick and easy to make. Definitely will make again.
I will definitely make it again. My family really liked it.
Made it as the recipe states. Next time I’ll add more ham and cheese and some bell peppers but we loved it!
i added some dijon mustard to egg mixture and I used a spicy pepperjack and habenaro cheese blend, very good but not to spicy, next time maybe 1/2 cheddar as well with spicy cheese
We added diced tomatoes at thy the end. This is a fabulous dish!!
I love this recipe! So easy and can be made the night before and just reheated. Great for busy mornings. Thank you for sharing!

This one is a winner. My son and husband absolutely loved it. I didn’t make too many changes. I didn’t find shredded pepper jack cheese, so I used slices instead and only one layer. It was just the right amount of spice. I also added some fresh chopped tomatoes and a red bell pepper. This was perfect, as I had leftover ham from Christmas and can’t think of anything better that I could have used it for. I will definitely be making this again. I served oranges, blueberries and bananas to go with because it’s all the fruit I had and it went very well with the little spice from the pepper jack. Thank you Lorrie for this one.

I made per recipe for dinner and served with biscuits. Husband and daughter liked it. I added salsa to my serving and husband added chalula to his. Next time I will add mushrooms, spinach and roma tomatoes.
Sweetened condensed milk is *not* the same thing as condensed milk. Tasted like bread pudding with ham.

We love this dish! Perfect for a family get together so I made a double batch. I did change a couple things, I added some freshly minced garlic and some turmeric. Otherwise stayed with the recipe! Thx SO much to whoever submitted this one! Merry Christmas!

Made as written (except for pepperjack cheese, as it was for children. I used Colby Jack) and it turned out very nicely. I doubled the recipe and used a 9x13 dish. For adults only I might use a more spicy mix with jalapenos or chillies.

This was a great egg casserole! I doubled the recipe and used 12 eggs instead of 8 for the doubled egg casserole recipe. I also used a three cheddar cheese blend instead of pepper jack. My whole family loved this!!
Yes it is great for company breakfast or brunch.
bland
I used sausage instead of ham and doubled the recipe. Had to cook for an hour and a half. Next time will use half the milk. Delicious!
We really enjoyed this. I’ve made it twice now. It’s good to keep around to take for lunch during the week.
Excellent New Year's Day hangover breakfast with some bloody Mary's. Thanks for the recipe!
This turned out really well! I used Mexican shredded cheese. Added sweet Italian sausage and broccoli. Used the O'brien potatoes w/onions and peppers along with chopped onions. Great dish!

I added one extra egg, and used dried minced onion in place of green onions. Made this at 10am to have for dinner. Served with tea biscuits. Perfect size for 4 dinner servings. Nice to make ahead and pop in the oven after a long day of work.
Super yummy, thanks for sharing!

this was very good. I did add sauteed shredded onion and diced bell pepper and an extra egg. one reviewer mentioned that is does take much longer to bake than the recipie says and I agree. I baked it for a little over an hour.

I doubled the recipe and used 10 eggs. Used Cooked sausage instead of ham, buttermilk instead of evaporated milk and topped with small can of diced green chilies and homemade salsa. Increased baking temperature to 365 and baked until golden brown and set. The increase in temperature and time may be because I live at 10,300 ft. It was really delicious. Everyone I served it to loved it!
My husband liked it - I didn't care for it.

Really want to like this but it takes too long to cook. This is my third time making it and it still takes 90 mins to cook!! Tried covered, uncovered, this time covered then uncovered and still takes too long. Maybe next time I’ll use less milk or use regular milk.
Great recipe! I used sharp cheddar instead of pepper jack

Thanks for sharing. I used grated cheddar and grated monterey jack since that's what I had on hand. Used O'Brien potatoes as others had suggested. I made this for guests and they enjoyed it, and went back for seconds! Success!
Came out really yummy. I may have misunderstood and not layered it but it still tasted great!

This recipe tasted fairly good. My husband said it could have used some bacon, and I agree so next time I will add some bacon. The pepper jack cheese gives it a nice kick, but that may be too much spice early in the morning.
hashbrowns did not cook. Not enough eggs. Will not make this again.

If I had the option, I'd give it 4.5 stars. My wife and I both really liked it, but would add more to it next time. Mushrooms and spinach, maybe some white onions in addition to the green onions. When I was making it I didn't think the pepperjack cheese was enough, but it ended up being just the right amount and gave the recipe a better kick than expected. Absolutely going to make this again!

We like this made in muffin tins, it makes 12 btw. Gives us more crusty part, which we love. I had Colby Jack cheese, which was a little mild. Adding cooked sausage or bacon would be good, as would browning the ham and regular onion.
I liked it but would cut down on the onions and maybe use sausage instead of ham.

This was really easy and good. Just one suggestion, I would have liked the hash browns to be crispier and maybe would cook them first in the oven till crisp and then filled with the rest and baked again, but nobody else seemed to care or notice. They loved it.
I'm a real huge fan of breakfast casseroles and really enjoyed this recipe, thank you!

I followed the directions, preparing it the night before and refrigerating until morning. I used regular hash browns and mixing in green onions and spices with them. I used more cheese than the recipe called for and added lots of ham. I also added cooked bacon on top prior to baking. My husband and I loved it. Very moist. The great thing about this recipe is that it works with customization to satisfy everyone.

I give this 5 stars for how easy and flavorful this breakfast casserole was! I would not recommend substituting fat free evaporated milk (like I did) as it took about 20 minutes longer in the oven to set up. Next time I am going to try O'brien hash browns and leave out the onion which is in the O'briens... saving even more time!!!

I used Potatoes O'Brien but otherwise made this exactly as written. My husband, who has never been a fan of breakfast casseroles loved this one! Next time I will layer it in a Bundt pan because I had trouble getting it done in the middle. We'll add this into our monthly rotation. It's so easy to mix up and has ingredients that I always have on hand. I served it with fruit and zucchini bread and it made a perfect Sunday night dinner! It will be great to have this recipe for when I forget to take meat out of the freezer. Thanks for sharing!

08/20/17: Made for SS class. I used a whole bag of hash browns, doubled the eggs, used shredded Monterrey jack cheese, doubled the pepper-next time triple, used 1/4 t salt and 1/2 t tony's-next time it needs a little bit more, added garlic powder-next time maybe add a little onion powder as well. 1 can of milk was plenty.

I was cautiously optimistic while putting this together last night as we are not really casserole lovers (at least not the way I make them). Since there are just 2 of us, I halved the recipe (more or less) and used a 7" Pampered Chef round pan. I didn't have green onions so I added some grated Walla Walla Sweet onion. As a personal preference, I added some Dijon and sweet paprika to the eggs but otherwise followed the recipe. This morning I baked it for 45 minuted and it was done even in the center. I think the secret for getting this all the way done is to use smaller pans (9" or less). The verdict: my 8 y/o thought it was too spicy but after adding a dollop of sour cream he enjoyed it. I thought it was very good. On my second piece, I added a sliced just-picked Roma tomato and a little fresh basil. That was also very good. Now, on my third piece... ;)

We love breakfast casseroles in our house and this one was delicious. Our biggest issue was that it wasn't bigger! I look for recipes in 13" x 9" pans; this one was only 8" x 8". But I'm sure it would be easy enough to increase by half to fill a larger dish. Also, next time I think I may add some canned green chilies to it for a little extra spice. Hubbie loved it just the way it was though. :)

Made this today and we had it for supper. It was very easy and very good. For those that don't do breakfast for supper don't know what they are missing. If you are unfamiliar with supper, it is a farmers dinner............ Love this recipe.

Thanks for this good brunch. My husband and I love it. A keeper.
Thanks again,

I didn't have hashbrowns so I used potatoes o'brian and it is wonderful. I also added some diced mushrooms and it was delicious! My whole house smells wonderful and it's a great make ahead meal to bring to work. Thanks!

This was just Ok for me. I'm a huge fan of breakfast for dinner, but I found it on the dry side. Maybe I used too many hashbrowns? I added 2 extra eggs as well and more shredded cheese on top. I doubt I'll make this again.
This was a simple and very tasty recipe. I doubled the recipe and put it in a 4 & 1/2 quart baking dish. The time to cook is at minimum 1 hour and a half.
I used left over baked potatoes and cut them into small hash brown size pieces. My husband and I loved it!! I will definitely make it again.
No alterations as I was preparing it for a #group #church #supper #Kansas. So easy to prepare and love the do ahead feature!

It was fine fresh and pretty much the same left over. I thought the frozen hashbrowns made the dish a little watery and mushy. If I try again, I'll brown the hashbrowns before layering up with the rest of the ingredients.

I did 5 oz of evap milk like most comments suggested then did 8 oz sour cream for the egg mixture....did potatoes o brian instead of hash browns. Turned out nice. I think im gonna do cream cheese instead of sour cream and heavy cream instead of evap milk to try a creamier attempt next time.
Followed the recipe. It was delicious and a great recipe to make when having guests for a couple of days and not enough time to make breakfast everyday. I would recommend it!
I'm making it now but I wasn't sure if I should cook it covered or uncovered. I'm cooking it covered so I'll let you know how it turns out!

I absolutely love this recipe. This is my favorite breakfast casserole. With that being said, I think anyone that is making this recipe should consider whether the 1/8 tsp of salt is enough for the amount of food. I found that the salt needs to be tweaked a little bit from 1/8 tsp. (This, of course, varies among cooks. So I don't use it when judging a recipe.) I have made this recipe numerous times. I am currently using about 1/2 tsp at this point. I have also used Monterey Jack cheese as a viable substitute. Almost anything would work.

This was very good but a little bit watery. If I make it again, I will probably add more eggs and less evaporated milk. Also, after pouring the egg and evaporated milk mixture over the top of everything, including the cheese, the cheese still got too browned . If I make it again, I'll mix the cheese into the casserole a little bit, or, cover with a loose foil tent until the last 15 to 20 minutes, or, simply wait until the last 15 to 20 mintues before adding the cheese. I had to take the hard brown layer of cheese off (it came off in a big slab) and I had to replace it with more cheese and bake it for an additional 15 minutes for the newly added cheese to melt.

This is a very bland version of what I enjoyed at home growing up. Skip the pepper jack & go for a more flavorful cheese. Or, follw my mom's lead & vary the ingredients by season. In the Winter she would add in equal amounts ham, green pepper & onion with colby or mild cheddar for a Western casserole, in the Spring, she would blanch & cut up a pound of fresh asparagus & use muenster or sharp cheddar for Spring casserole. In the Summer, it was well drained diced tomatoes & lots of onion & substituting bacon for the ham along with sharp cheddar. In the fall, chopped broccoli & medium cheddar. This recipe reminded me of those wonderful eats of the past. I had forgotten about them. 
 Since I have a pound of asparagus in the refrigerator and some extra frozen hash browns on hand, I think I shall make another one using mom's flavors & this as a proportion guide for the other elements. So, while not the tastiest recipe I have found here, this may prove one of the most adaptable. If you liked it, but didn't love it, I hope you consider some of my mom's variations.
My hubby liked this better than another breakfast casserole I make.
This recipe is very good, easy, and fast to prepare. I did not have cooked ham, so I used what I had which was smoked ham. The recipe came out tasty. Will make it again.

I made this with leftover Easter ham. It is a very good breakfast casserole! I followed the suggestion from others and used the Ore Ida Potatoes O'Brien. I put the casserole together and then put it in my oven. It took longer than the recipe says to fully cook: about an hour rather than 45 minutes. I will also add a few more spices next time. A great base though, and plenty of room to improvise!

This was easy and delicious, I made it for dinner one night. I added a bit of fresh spinach leaves. Next time I'll try the Potatoes O'Brien that other reviewers have mentioned. Easy to make, tasty, great for a quick dinner!
Mm
Great Dish - used 1/2 pepper jack cheese, 1/2 sharp cheddar. Definitely use high quality sausage, drain thoroughly. Super easy for weekend or holiday brunch.

I made this for Easter brunch yesterday, as I needed a gluten free casserole for my celiac guests. I doubled the recipe for a 13x9 pan and roasted the O'Brien hash browns as suggested. It didn't necessarily keep them crispy (they'd been sitting in liquid all night!), but perhaps it did add a bit of extra flavor. I think next time I'll use more hash browns. This recipe was okay, but everyone (who didn't need G/F) much preferred the Zippy Egg Casserole to this one.
I didn't have Cheddar cheese, so used mozzarella and pepperjack. We all liked it, but I think cheddar would have been better. Next time.
First time making this recipe. Loved it. Definitely a keeper.
followed the recipe and it was very good,I will make this again!
Absolutely delicious. I followed recipe to a T. It was devoured. Next time I will add peppers and onions. It is a keeper,

Yum. I have a hash brown casserole my family loves but this really mixes it up. I added some additional veggies to the original recipe and then made a version that was veggie only with peppers, asparagus, mushrooms, etc. and both are great
I used canned ham, I believe that's why I wasn't very impressed next time I'll use better ham.

Yes, I used Medium Cheddar ( on hand) & 1/4 cup chopped Jalapeno peppers- it was fantastic & will do it again, next time I'll use pepper jack cheese & no peppers! Could also add mushrooms, mixed veggies- the possibilities are endless!
After scaling the recipe down to just 2 servings, it seemed like a lot of work and time - for just two - but well worth it. We liked it very much.

Not bad. Used Ore Ida O'Brien potatoes as recommended, and 10 oz evap milk b/c that's what I had; used sharp cheddar and some red pepper flakes b/c that's what I had. Used turkey ham. Did take an extra ten minutes to firm up.
Next time I will add more eggs. It had good flavor but was mostly hash browns and sausage.
